name: Congenital Intestinal Malrotation with Volvulus
chief_complaint: My baby is vomiting green fluid and has a swollen belly
prognosis: Good with prompt surgical intervention, but risk of short bowel syndrome if significant intestinal necrosis occurs
description: A life-threatening congenital anomaly where the intestines fail to rotate properly during fetal development, leading to twisting (volvulus) that can compromise blood supply. Most commonly presents in neonates but can occur in older children. Requires immediate surgical intervention to prevent bowel necrosis.
